results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: Homosexuality: a film for discussion
results.brief_description: Designed to dispel the myths about homosexuality. Homosexuals talk about their lives, their relationships and the difficulties of growing up gay in an oppressive, intolerant society. Parents of gays speak out and the Melbourne public expresses its view on the subject.

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.

results.title: Broken white line
results.brief_description: A documentation of the role of an Aboriginal social worker, depicting the enormity of the problems he is called upon to help solve in the Aboriginal community. DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL, TEACHER PREVIEW OF THE FILM BEFORE CLASSROOM SCREENING IS ESSENTIAL.

results.title: The Job Interview
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A depressed job-seeker is frustrated in his attempts to obtain work. His fairy-job mother encourages him to consider his positive attributes and apply them in his interviews. Features Graeme Blundell Julie McGregor.

A compilation of two programs which examine the role of computers at work: 1. Computers as work aids in transport (16 min). - 2. Impact of computers in local government (16 min).

results.title: My survival as a deviant
results.brief_description: Director Toby Zoates takes his camera to the squats of inner Sydney in an attempt to ascertain who the real deviants of society are - those who choose to do things their own way, or those that try to stop them. Utilising the cinema verite style and a punk soundtrack, he interviews a cross-section of people affected by issues such as unemployment and drugs, and examines the tactics those disenfranchised by societal pressures use to survive. This documentary, shot during Malcolm Fraser’s reign as Prime Minister, looks at the mundane reality of life for many young people, and aims to persuade viewers to take political action against a system that is seen to oppress individuality and demonise non-conformist behaviour. Filmed around Pyrmont, Kings Cross, and Chippendale.
